Hi, I'm Josh Trommel.

I code things in Ruby. I live in in Vancouver, British Columbia, and this is my blog. I code things on Github and share stupid thoughts on Twitter. You can also email me if you'd like.

Josh Trommel

10 November 2013

November 10, 2013

Hi again.

First off, I've been making a couple changes with domains, and want to get that cleared off. I know this probably isn't 'blog' material, but whatever. imjosh.me is my main website. I don't really have much there, other than a couple links to different social networks. I'm planning to do something with it eventually. My other domain is joshuatrommel.com which, as you can see if you click the link, is being used for my svbtle blog. I've moved from WordPress because I was finally invited (after months of waiting) to svbtle.com, so I moved everything from WordPress over here, and I'm glad everything went smoothly because I don't want to go back to WordPress any time soon. Good, now that's off my chest and hopefully everyone knows where to go.

Today was a great day. Productive in a certain aspect, non-productive whatsoever in another. Today, I sat at home for almost 12 hours screwing around with my Wii. I also Skyped with Lakota and his friend for a couple hours, and talked to Mercedez all day. I didn't even make myself food, I just had cereal twice, and leftover chicken from Montana's last night. While I was doing this, everyone else went to America, land of the free (haha not really). Pretty antisocial, I guess, but in retrospect it makes sense (kinda), because everyone is so loud. I don't care for loud people, unless there's a certain reason they have to be loud. Anyways, I'm getting a little off topic, which I tend to do quite often. Ahem.

After 10 years of craving Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker I finally got it working.. kinda. I softmodded my Wii, and then installed a couple files that allow it to run files from a USB. I then found the .ISO file for it on some random website, burned it to the USB, and finally got everything working perfectly. The entire 'project' took about 4 hours. I then played Wind Waker for at least 10 hours (I lost track of time). Total time waster, but I'm glad I did it, because it was awesome. My next 'project' is to get the Ocarina of Time game working, because it's apparently awesome, according to this tweet.

Other than that, I didn't really do anything today. But I think everyone needs days like that once in a while.

A quiet peaceful day to play Zelda.
